channel.title: Tech Radar Books
channel.description: An opinionated collection of books for the items on ThoughtWorks technology radar by a few ThoughtWorkers and ex-ThoughtWorkers.

item.title: Free book: Think DSP
item.description:
Think DSP is an introduction to Digital Signal Processing in Python.
Author: Allen Downey | Section: 79.Python 3
Lang: EN | Pages: 164 | Year: 2014
item.dc:creator: Peng Xiao

item.title: Free book: Think Python
item.description:
Think Python is an introduction to Python programming for beginners. It starts with basic concepts of programming, and is carefully designed to define all terms when they are first used and to develop each new concept in a logical progression. Larger pieces, like recursion and object-oriented programming are divided into a sequence of smaller steps and introduced over the course of several chapters.
Author: Allen Downey | Section: 79.Python 3
Lang: EN | Pages: 244 | Year: 2015
item.dc:creator: Peng Xiao

item.title: Free book: Think Python

Author: Allen Downey | Section: 80.ReactiveX

Lang: EN | Pages: 119 | Year: 2016

item.title: Free book: The Road to learn React
item.description:
A lot of roadmaps exist on how to master React. This book uses the common sense of these roads and weaves it into the implementation of an attractive real world app. You will build a React app, which consumes the Hacker News API. On the road you will learn ES6, React with all its basics and advanced concepts and internal state management.
Author: Robin Wieruch | Section: 82.Avro
Lang: EN | Pages: 101 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Peng Xiao

item.title: Free book: The Road to learn React
item.description:

This book uses the common sense of these roads and weaves it into the implementation of an attractive real world app. You will build a React app, which consumes the Hacker News API. On the road you will learn ES6, React with all its basics and advanced concepts and internal state management.
Author: Robin Wieruch | Section: 81.React
Lang: EN | Pages: 101 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Peng Xiao

item.title: Free book: Build Pacman
item.description:
Learn Modern Javascript, HTML5 Canvas, and a bit of Ember.js. This is a book about surviving an alien invasion and using web technologies.
Author: Jeffrey Biles | Section: 78.Ember.js
Lang: EN | Pages: 189 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Peng Xiao

item.title: Free book: React.js Succinctly
item.description:
In React.js Succinctly, author Samer Buna introduces the novel approach to building user interfaces that React provides, and walks readers through the basics of declarative user interfaces, React components, working with user input, and more.
Author: Samer Buna | Section: 81.React
Lang: EN | Pages: 102 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Peng Xiao

item.title: Free book: Automate Boring Stuff With Python
item.description:
In Automate the Boring Stuff with Python, you'll learn how to use Python to write programs that do in minutes what would take you hours to do by hand no prior programming experience required.
Author: Al Sweigart | Section: 79.Python 3
Lang: EN | Pages: 479 | Year: 2015
item.dc:creator: Peng Xiao

item.title: Free book: The Hitchhiker’s Guide to Python
item.description:
This handcrafted guide exists to provide both novice and expert Python developers a best practice handbook to the installation, configuration, and usage of Python on a daily basis.
Author: Kenneth Reitz | Section: 79.Python 3
Lang: EN | Pages: 119 | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: Peng Xiao

item.title: Free book: Ember Tutorial
item.description:
This tutorial provides an introduction to the Ember.js framework. It shows you how to build an Ember.js app with a Ruby on Rails backend while explaining all the underlying concepts along the way.
Author: Vic Ramon | Section: 78.Ember.js
Lang: EN | Pages: 22 | Year: 2014
item.dc:creator: Peng Xiao

item.title: Free book: A byte of Python
item.description:
This is a free book on programming using the Python language. It serves as a tutorial or guide to the Python language for a beginner audience. If all you know about computers is how to save text files, then this is the book for you.
Author: Swaroop C H | Section: 80.ReactiveX
Lang: EN | Pages: 176 | Year: 2014
item.dc:creator: Peng Xiao

item.title: Free book: Learn Python The Hard Way
item.description:
This book instructs you in Python by slowly building and establishing skills through techniques like practice and memorization, then applying them to increasingly difficult problems. By the end of the book you will have the tools needed to begin learning more complex programming topics.
Author: Zed A. Shaw | Section: 80.ReactiveX
Lang: EN | Pages: 58 | Year: 2014
item.dc:creator: Peng Xiao
